## Selected Data Science Projects

- Adobe Classification

### Adobe Classification

The goal of this project was to assign metadata to marketing campaigns using Adobe Analytics. Prior to this project, marketing data was stored locally in our data warehouses but was unavailable in Adobe Analytics. What this project accomplished was syncing these two data sources so that we can easily build reports on the fly in Adobe Analytics using our internal data.

<img src = "Portfolio/Adobe-Classification/img/name_and_manager.png?raw=true">

*The figure above shows an example of a breakdown in Adobe Analytics that utilizes the classification implemented in this project. Notice, we are able to view each step in our signup flow using internal metrics such as marketing Manager and Department. This ability to roll up marketing campaigns into aggregate groups based on user-defined properties is crucial for alignment between Market Mix Models and Finance.*

![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Adobe%20Analytics-white?logo=Adobe&logoColor=red)[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Python-white?logo=Python)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Jupyter-white?logo=Jupyter)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Pandas-white?logo=data:image/png;base64,)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/SQL-white?logo=Microsoft%20SQL%20Server&logoColor=red)](#) 

[View Sample on Github](https://github.com/jakehanson/jakehanson.github.io/tree/master/Portfolio/Adobe-Classification)

### Bill Date Optimization

Using high-resolution customer data linked to bank accounts we train a machine learning model to predict the best time to bill. Test

**Published**: Corporate Internal

**Skills**: API Calls

Python, Pandas, Data Viz, Machine Learning - XGBoost

### Adobe Marketing Channel Classification
In this project, I added metadata to our market mix model tracking cookie so that we could segment reports based on external meta-data. For example, I added manager, department, and customer journey information to each individual tracking cookie. These results could then be used as a tool for all adobe analytics reports. The project involved indepth engagement with the Adobe Analytics platform, including classification schemes.

**Skills:** Adobe Analytics, Market Mix Modeling

<img src="images/mobility.png?raw=true" />

[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Python-white?logo=Python)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Jupyter-white?logo=Jupyter)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Google-white?logo=Google)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Apple-white?logo=Apple)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/pandas-white?logo=data:image/png;base64,)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/NumPy-white?logo=data:image/png;base64,)](#)

### Discount Testing
Here we A/B test different discounts for the transunion (TU) report fee. The metric for success is the paids/offer and we find that different departments have different optimal TU fees. We build a model that targets the user with the correct TU fee based on their department and show that this results in a average lift of 30%. 

[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Python-white?logo=Python)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Jupyter-white?logo=Jupyter)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/sklearn-white?logo=scikit-learn)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Scikit%20Optimize-white?logo=data:image/png;base64,)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/pandas-white?logo=data:image/png;base64,)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/NumPy-white?logo=data:image/png;base64,)](#)

[View code on Colab](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1eMRq-WAtegW5_J5OhTPWoeB3QNf64D-A?usp=sharing)

### The Statistics of Sequential A/B Tests
One of the most common theoretical problems faced by marketers is what happens when a series of A/B tests are running simultaneosly. In other words, do the results from a test early on in a web visit bias the results of all later tests? Here, I prove that as long as the proportions of the test allocation are fixed in each branch across time, than the results of any individual test can be considered in isolation. That said, the time it takes for an individual test to converge increases exponentially the more tests that are running simultaneously.

Probability Theory, Applied Mathematics, A/B Testing, Web Optimization, Marketing, Proofs

[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Python-white?logo=Python)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/MongoDB-white?logo=mongodb)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Scrapy-white?logo=scrapy)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Bash-white?logo=GNUbash)](#)

[Download File](https://github.com/mattschapman/mattschapman.github.io/tree/master/projects/mongodb_crawler/spiders)

### Modeling the Interior of the Dwarf Planet Haumeau

Haumea is a dwarf planet located beyond Neptune's orbit. Due to its small size, its shape cannot be accurately determined as the angular size is less than a pixel. Nonetheless, we can infer that Haumea is a rotating body with varying semi-major and semi-minor axes based on periodic changes in brightness that correspond to different ellipsoidal faces being exposed. To model the planet's morphology and internal composition, we assume it is a Jacobi Ellipsoid and simulate a stable, 3D self-gravitating body with Haumea's observed rotational period.

References: [Hachisu 1961, Dunham et al. 2019]

![alt text](https://github.com/jakehanson/Haumea/blob/master/MODEL_001/density_sim.gif)*Self-consistent 3D gravitational simulation of the dwarf planet Haumea.*

[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/C++-00599C?logo=c%2B%2B)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Numerical_Hydrodynamics-FF0000?color=important)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Theoretical_Physics-gray?)](#) 

[View Code on Github](https://github.com/jakehanson/Haumea)

### Ethograms
Here, we visualize ant behavior as a function of time for the ant colony *Temnothorax regatulus* during nest-site selection. I also create a learning tool in the form of a webpage that allows users to interactively specify parameters for the nest site selection process.

Javascript, HTML, CSS, Python, Seaborn

### Assessing Tweet Sentiment
Here, we examine the lagged mutual information between tweet sentiment and stock prices using the Twitter API. We find that stock price fluctuations often precipitate changes in tweet sentiment, making them a poor indicator of price movement for blue chip stocks.

Skills: Twitter API,

### Backtesting Pre-Earnings Straddles

A pre-earnings straddle is an options trading strategy designed to capitalize on volatility by taking out matched calls and puts right before earnings are released. Here, we show that pre-earnings straddles are not a winning strategy over the long-term, despite claims to the contrary. The reason for this is that the volatility is priced in well-before earnings.

Skills: Volatility, Backtesting, Quantitative Finance, Python

<!-- <img src="images/random_intercept.png?raw=true"/> -->

[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/R-white?logo=R)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Python-white?logo=Python)](#) [![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Jupyter-white?logo=Jupyter)](#) 

View code on Github

### Karhunen-Loeve Image Projection

Here, I implement an image processing algorithm designed for the detection of exoplanets in high-contrast environment (i.e. faint exoplanets next to bright stars). This algorithm is still in use and is partially responsible for the discovery of dozens of new expolanets.

Image Processing, Interactive Data Langauge, Applied Mathematics,

Refs: 

Skills: Volatility, Backtesting, Quantitative Finance, Python

<!-- ### Did lockdowns influence the types of music people were listening to?
COVID-19 has created an ostensible paradox in the music industry. In the four months after the World Health Organisation declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11, 2020, digital music streaming providers such as Spotify and Apple saw their share prices soar by 114% and 49% respectively (Google 2021b). Over the same period, however, worldwide digital music consumption dropped by an average of 12.5% (Sim et al. 2021). One of the reasons which has been suggested for this drop is the decline in certain types of mobility - especially driving, which accounts for 29% of music consumption, and commuting, as 54% of commuters listen to music while commuting (Nielsen 2015, 2017; Sim et al. 2021). What remains unclear, however, is whether and how changes to levels of mobility influenced the types of music to which people were listening. In this project, I investigate these questions using the Spotify API.

<img src="images/spotify.png?raw=true" />
